topic.title: Contribute to Content Security Policy for Plugins

body.p: Plugins can contribute to the Content Security Policy (CSP). For more information about the Content Security Policy, see and .

To allow a plugin to contribute to the Content Security Policy:
Create a class that implements ro.sync.exml.plugin.workspace.security.CspPolicyProviderExtension.
Reference the class in your plugin.xml file: <extension type="CspPolicy" class="com.example.ClassName"/>You can also specify the CSP for static resources like this:<extension type="WebappStaticResourcesFolder" path="path/to/folder" csp="default-src 'self' www.google.com; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline';"/>
where the value of the csp property is the value of the Content Security Policy header.
